xxl.core.pipes.sinks
Class Tester<I>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sinks.AbstractSink<I>
          xxl.core.pipes.sinks.Tester<I>
Type Parameters:
I -
All Implemented Interfaces:
Heartbeat, Node, Sink<I>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class Tester<I>
extends AbstractSink<I>
implements Heartbeat

Sink component in a query graph that is usally used for test purposes. This kind of sink counts the elements streaming in and monitors the time spent for processing. Furthermore, it is able to write this information to a user-defined print stream.

Example usage (1): 

        new Tester(new Enumerator(100000, 0), DEFAULT_ID, System.out, true, 10000, false);
Note that Tester does not rely on temporal objects, but implements the interface Heartbeat.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
PrintStream

Constructor Detail

Tester

public Tester(PrintStream stream,
              boolean intermediateOutput,
              int every)

Tester

public Tester(Source<? extends I> source,
              int ID,
              PrintStream stream,
              boolean intermediateOutput,
              int every)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that prints time and count information to the specified PrintStream.

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
ID - This sink uses the given ID for subscription.
stream - Measurements are written to this PrintStream.
intermediateOutput - If true an intermediate output is generated, otherwise not.
every - Every every elements the time and count information is written to the specified PrintStream, if the flag intermediateOutput is set.

Tester

public Tester(Source<? extends I> source)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that prints the completion time and the number of elements completely processed to Java's standard output stream System.out
The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription.

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.

Tester

public Tester(Source<? extends I> source,
              PrintStream stream)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that prints the completion time and the number of elements completely processed to the specified PrintStream.
The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The input rate is not measured.

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
stream - Measurements are written to this PrintStream.
Method Detail

processObject

public void processObject(I o,
                          int sourceID)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
The counter is incremented. If the flag intermediateOutput is set, every every elements the current counter and the time passed from starting this sink are written to the specified PrintStream.

Specified by:
processObject in class AbstractSink<I>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - The ID this sink specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

                      int sourceID)
Description copied from interface: Heartbeat
This method accepts a heartbeat(the timestamp) from the source with the given id.

Specified by:
heartbeat in interface Heartbeat
Parameters:
timeStamp - the heartbeat.
sourceID - the source id from the source that deliverd the heartbeat.
